tourism.name: San Juan Alicante Tourism
tourism.description: Discover more about San Juan Alicante

content.metaTitle: Сан-Хуан Аликанте Коста-Бланка: Полный жилищный и имущественный справочник
content.metaDescription: Откройте для себя Сан-Хуан Аликанте на Коста-Бланке. Современные квартиры от €443.825. Климат, удобства, руководство для эмигрантов и инвестиционные идеи.
content.heroIntro:
Сан-Хуан Аликанте представляет динамичное жилищное направление на испанском побережье Коста-Бланка, предлагающее идеальное сочетание современного средиземноморского образа жизни и городского удобства. Расположенный в северных пригородах города Аликанте, этот современный район выявился как главное место как для испанских граждан, так и для международных покупателей, ищущих качественные квартиры с превосходной инфраструктурой и доступностью. Район сочетает спокойствие жилых районов с близостью к динамичному центру Аликанте, потрясающим пляжам и более широкому региону Коста-Бланка.

Разработанный в соответствии с современными принципами городского планирования, Сан-Хуан имеет хорошо спроектированные жилые комплексы, современные удобства и растущее сообщество молодых специалистов и семей. Район пользуется отличными дорожными соединениями через магистрали N-340 и AP-7, что делает его идеальной базой для работающих в Аликанте, предпочитающих более просторную жилую среду. Благодаря новым зданиям, выходящим на рынок, Сан-Хуан Аликанте предлагает инвесторам и покупателям жилья возможность приобрести современные квартиры в стратегически расположенном месте с сильным потенциалом роста.

Образ жизни на Коста-Бланке синоним солнца, золотых пляжей и занятий на свежем воздухе. Сан-Хуан Аликанте служит идеальным входом в этот средиземноморский рай, предлагая жителям легкий доступ к пляжам мирового класса, полям для гольфа, ресторанам и развлекательным заведениям, сохраняя при этом более непринужденный темп, чем центр города.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Life in San Juan Alicante embodies the relaxed Costa Blanca spirit while offering modern suburban conveniences. Residents enjoy a strong community atmosphere with excellent access to family-friendly facilities, quality restaurants, and shopping centers. The neighborhood attracts a diverse population including families, young professionals, and increasing numbers of northern European expats seeking Mediterranean living. The expat community is well-established with numerous support networks, international schools, and English-speaking services readily available throughout Alicante and surrounding areas.

Daily life revolves around outdoor activities, Mediterranean cuisine, and a balanced work-life dynamic. Weekend routines typically include beach visits to nearby Playa del Postiguet or Playa de San Juan, dining at waterfront restaurants, or enjoying the numerous golf courses dotting the Costa Blanca landscape. The neighborhood maintains a safe, well-maintained environment with modern infrastructure, and residents benefit from the Costa Blanca's renowned hospitality industry and leisure culture. Shopping, dining, and entertainment options cater to international tastes while maintaining authentic Spanish character.

San Juan Alicante enjoys one of Spain's most enviable climates, with over 300 days of sunshine annually and mild Mediterranean weather year-round. Summer temperatures typically range from 28-32°C (82-90°F), while winters remain pleasantly mild at 8-15°C (46-59°F). The area experiences minimal rainfall, concentrated primarily in autumn and spring months. Sea breezes from the nearby Mediterranean provide natural cooling during hot months, and the coastal proximity moderates temperature extremes. This exceptional climate supports an outdoor lifestyle throughout the year, making it ideal for beach lovers, sports enthusiasts, and those seeking escape from harsher northern European winters.
highlights: Exceptional Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of annual sunshine and mild winters
Direct beach access to Playa de San Juan with water sports and beach clubs offering Mediterranean lifestyle
Strategic location 8km from Alicante Airport with excellent road connections to broader Costa Blanca
Modern infrastructure with new build properties featuring contemporary amenities and quality construction
Established expat community with English-speaking services, international schools, and diverse social networks

amenitiesSection.beaches: Sports and recreation opportunities abound in San Juan Alicante. Playa de San Juan and Playa del Postiguet offer pristine beaches perfect for swimming, beach volleyball, and water sports including paddleboarding and kitesurfing. Numerous golf courses including Bonalba Golf, Villaitana Golf Club, and Meliá Golf are within 15-25km. Tennis courts, fitness centers, and modern sports facilities operate throughout the neighborhood. The Marina de Alicante provides sailing and yacht clubs for maritime enthusiasts.
amenitiesSection.dining: San Juan Alicante's dining scene reflects Mediterranean excellence with numerous restaurants offering everything from traditional Spanish cuisine to international gastronomy. Beachfront restaurants along Playa de San Juan serve fresh seafood and paella within minutes. The neighborhood features tapas bars, pizzerias, Indian, Chinese, and fusion restaurants. Nearby city center offers Michelin-recommended restaurants and diverse culinary experiences. Waterfront dining at Puerto de Alicante combines stunning views with exceptional cuisine just 6km away.
amenitiesSection.shopping: Shopping options range from modern shopping centers to local markets and specialty stores. Centro Comercial El Corte Inglés in central Alicante (12km) offers premium shopping, while Carrefour and Mercadona supermarkets serve the neighborhood for daily needs. Bulevar Shopping Center and Ágora shopping centers provide diverse retail, entertainment, and dining options. A weekly traditional market operates in Alicante city center with fresh local produce, seafood, and regional specialties.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: San Juan Alicante has excellent healthcare facilities with the prestigious Hospital General Universitario de Alicante located just 8km away, providing comprehensive medical services. Private clinics including Quirónsalud Alicante offer premium healthcare options. Local pharmacies are abundant throughout the neighborhood, and English-speaking medical professionals are readily available. The area benefits from Spain's excellent healthcare system and comprehensive coverage options for residents.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante-Elche Airport (ALC) is conveniently located just 8km south, offering direct flights to major European cities and serving as the primary gateway to Costa Blanca. Journey time by car is approximately 15 minutes. The airport features excellent car rental facilities, public transportation connections, and modern amenities. Valencia Airport (VLC) is approximately 170km north for alternative flight options. San Juan Alicante benefits from excellent road connectivity via the N-340 national highway and AP-7 tollway, providing direct access to Valencia (165km north) and Murcia (150km south). The neighborhood connects seamlessly to Alicante city center (6-8km) via well-maintained urban roads. Benidorm (35km) and Torrevieja (45km) are easily accessible. Parking is abundant in the suburban setting, and most residents rely on private vehicles for convenient access to the broader Costa Blanca region. Public transportation in San Juan Alicante includes TRAM (tram) connections serving the northern corridor, buses operated by AUVASA connecting to Alicante city center and surrounding municipalities, and long-distance coaches for regional connections. Train services from Alicante-Terminal provide access to Valencia, Madrid, and other major Spanish cities. However, most residents prefer private vehicles for daily convenience in the suburban setting. Taxis and ride-sharing services operate throughout the area.

content.propertyMarketSection:
San Juan Alicante's property market shows healthy growth with increasing demand for modern new build apartments. The neighborhood attracts investors seeking rental income potential and families wanting quality suburban living. Market conditions reflect Costa Blanca's broader appeal as a Mediterranean investment destination with favorable exchange rates for European buyers. New construction projects are entering the market with contemporary designs and comprehensive amenities.

Popular property types include Apartment.

San Juan Alicante offers compelling investment potential with strong rental yields from the growing expat community and tourist demand. Proximity to Alicante Airport and beaches makes properties attractive to holiday renters and long-term tenants. New build apartments typically appreciate steadily, and professional property management companies serve the area effectively. Buy-to-let investors benefit from Spain's favorable tax treatment of rental income and the region's consistent tourism demand. Capital growth potential remains positive given infrastructure improvements and increasing international recognition of the Costa Blanca lifestyle destination.
whyLiveHereSection: Exceptional Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of annual sunshine and mild winters
Direct beach access to Playa de San Juan with water sports and beach clubs offering Mediterranean lifestyle
Strategic location 8km from Alicante Airport with excellent road connections to broader Costa Blanca
Modern infrastructure with new build properties featuring contemporary amenities and quality construction
Established expat community with English-speaking services, international schools, and diverse social networks

faqs.question: Is San Juan Alicante suitable for expat living?
faqs.answer: Yes, San Juan Alicante is excellent for expats with an established international community, English-speaking services, international schools, and numerous expat support networks. Many residents from northern Europe, UK, and other countries choose the area for its balance of modern amenities and Mediterranean lifestyle. The proximity to Alicante city provides cultural diversity and international infrastructure.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in San Juan Alicante?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is moderate compared to northern Europe, with affordable dining, utilities, and services. Healthcare is excellent and affordable. Groceries, transportation, and entertainment offer good value. Rental yields for buy-to-let investors typically range from 5-7% depending on property type and management.

faqs.question: How far is San Juan Alicante from the airport?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is conveniently located just 8km away, approximately 15 minutes by car. The airport offers excellent facilities, direct flights to major European cities, and convenient car rental services. This proximity makes San Juan Alicante ideal for frequent travelers and those maintaining European connections.

faqs.question: Are there good schools in San Juan Alicante?
faqs.answer: Yes, the area has quality educational options including Spanish public schools, several British international schools, and American schools nearby. Colegios such as Alegra School and international options serve expat families. The region maintains high educational standards with both Spanish and bilingual programs available.

faqs.question: What are the property rental opportunities in San Juan Alicante?
faqs.answer: San Juan Alicante offers strong rental potential with demand from long-term expat tenants and holiday visitors. Professional property management companies facilitate rentals. New build apartments typically attract quality tenants, and proximity to beaches and airport supports consistent demand. Annual rental yields typically range from 5-7% depending on property type and location.

faqs.question: What activities and entertainment are available?
faqs.answer: San Juan Alicante offers diverse activities including beach sports, swimming, paddleboarding, and kitesurfing at Playa de San Juan. Numerous golf courses, tennis facilities, and fitness centers operate throughout the area. Dining options range from beachfront seafood to international cuisine. Cultural attractions in Alicante city center, Marina entertainment complex, and nearby Costa Blanca destinations provide year-round entertainment.

faqs.question: How is public transportation in San Juan Alicante?
faqs.answer: Public transportation includes TRAM connections, buses to Alicante city center and surrounding areas, and long-distance coaches. Train services from Alicante-Terminal serve Valencia, Madrid, and other cities. However, most residents prefer private vehicles for convenience. Taxis and ride-sharing services are readily available throughout the neighborhood.

faqs.question: What makes new build apartments in San Juan Alicante a good investment?
faqs.answer: New build apartments offer modern construction, contemporary amenities, energy-efficient features, and warranty protection. Properties typically appreciate steadily while offering strong rental yields. The strategic location between airport and beaches, combined with established expat demand and growing international recognition, supports capital growth potential. Professional property management services facilitate rental operations.

content.conclusion: Ready to discover your perfect property in San Juan Alicante? Our experienced team specializes in new build properties across this area and can guide you through every step. Whether you're seeking a permanent home, holiday retreat, or investment property, we'll help you find exactly what you're looking for. Book a free 30-minute consultation with our team—with over 12 years of experience selling new builds on the Costa Blanca, we know this market inside out.

investmentAnalysis.overview: San Juan Alicante offers compelling investment potential with strong rental yields from the growing expat community and tourist demand. Proximity to Alicante Airport and beaches makes properties attractive to holiday renters and long-term tenants. New build apartments typically appreciate steadily, and professional property management companies serve the area effectively. Buy-to-let investors benefit from Spain's favorable tax treatment of rental income and the region's consistent tourism demand. Capital growth potential remains positive given infrastructure improvements and increasing international recognition of the Costa Blanca lifestyle destination.
highlights: Strong holiday rental demand during peak season (May-October)
Lower entry prices than comparable markets with similar rental returns
Growing international demand driving steady price appreciation
Short-term holiday lets popular with European tourists

costOfLiving.intro: Living costs in San Juan Alicante are significantly lower than Northern Europe and very competitive within Spain. Coastal living here combines affordability with Mediterranean lifestyle.

items.notes: Mercadona, Lidl, and local markets nearby
Higher in summer with air conditioning
Varies by development and included services
Annual property tax based on cadastral value
Comprehensive coverage; lower for younger residents

events.intro: San Juan Alicante celebrates traditional Spanish fiestas and community events throughout the year, blending local traditions with the welcoming international community.

events.name: Fiestas Patronales
events.description: Annual patron saint festivities with parades, music, fireworks, and traditional celebrations bringing the whole community together

events.name: Semana Santa (Easter Week)
events.description: Solemn Holy Week processions through the streets with traditional floats and centuries-old religious traditions

events.name: Día de la Constitución
events.description: National holiday celebrations with local events, markets, and community gatherings

events.name: Noche de San Juan
events.description: Magical midsummer beach celebrations with bonfires, fireworks, and midnight swimming traditions along the coast

events.name: Summer Beach Festival
events.description: Outdoor concerts, food stalls, and cultural events along the waterfront throughout the summer season

events.name: Christmas Market & Three Kings
events.description: Festive season with market stalls, nativity scenes, and the spectacular Three Kings parade (Cabalgata de Reyes)

schools.intro: Families in San Juan Alicante have access to quality education options in the surrounding area, with several international schools serving the expatriate community alongside excellent Spanish state schools.

schools.name: El Limonar International School
schools.description: British curriculum school with excellent facilities and strong academic record serving the expat community

schools.name: Newton College
schools.description: Bilingual international school offering both British and Spanish curricula with modern facilities

schools.name: Local Spanish Primary School
schools.description: Local state school providing Spanish curriculum education, excellent for language immersion and community integration

schools.name: Local Spanish Secondary School
schools.description: State secondary school offering ESO and Bachillerato programmes with supportive learning environment

natureActivities.intro: San Juan Alicante offers excellent outdoor activities year-round, from beach activities and water sports to golf, nature walks, and more.

activities.name: Beach & Swimming
activities.description: Beautiful Mediterranean beaches nearby with crystal-clear waters, perfect for swimming, snorkelling, and sunbathing

activities.name: Water Sports
activities.description: Paddleboarding, kayaking, windsurfing, and sailing available at nearby beaches and marinas

activities.name: Countryside Walking
activities.description: Walking trails through the surrounding countryside with views of orchards, mountains, and traditional villages

activities.name: Cycling Routes
activities.description: Road and mountain bike routes through the scenic countryside, suitable for all fitness levels

activities.name: Nearby Golf Courses
activities.description: Several quality golf courses within easy driving distance offering year-round play in the Mediterranean sun

activities.name: Nature Reserves & Birdwatching
activities.description: Protected natural areas nearby offering birdwatching, photography, and peaceful nature walks

expatCommunity.intro: San Juan Alicante has a thriving international community, with expatriates drawn by the Mediterranean lifestyle, affordable living costs, and welcoming atmosphere. The coastal location attracts a diverse mix of nationalities, particularly from Northern Europe. English is widely spoken in shops, restaurants, and social settings, making daily life comfortable for newcomers.
highlights: Active international social scene with regular community events
English-speaking services available including medical and legal professionals
Regular community gatherings, clubs, and social activities
Welcoming atmosphere for newcomers with established expat networks
Mix of permanent residents and seasonal visitors creating a dynamic community
Diverse European community including British, Scandinavian, Dutch, German, and French residents
Local Spanish community welcoming and inclusive toward international residents

lifestyleTimeline.title: A Typical Day in San Juan Alicante

entries.description: Start the day with fresh coffee on your terrace, enjoying the sea breeze and peaceful surroundings
Morning stroll along the beach or promenade, breathing in the fresh Mediterranean air
Pick up fresh bread, fruit, and local produce from the supermarket or weekly market
Enjoy a leisurely menú del día at a local restaurant—three courses with wine for around €12
Rest during the warmest hours, then cool off in your private or communal pool
Head to the beach for an afternoon swim in the warm Mediterranean waters
Join the locals for the traditional evening walk through town, greeting neighbours and friends
End the day with tapas and a glass of local wine at your favourite restaurant, dining al fresco under the stars

golf.intro: San Juan de Alicante offers convenient access to championship golf courses, with multiple courses within 10 minutes of the area. Golfers enjoy world-class facilities combined with Mediterranean climate and year-round playing conditions. The proximity to top-tier courses makes San Juan ideal for serious golf enthusiasts.

courses.name: Club de Golf Alicante
courses.description: Championship course with rolling terrain and Mediterranean views, featuring well-maintained fairways and challenging greens

courses.name: Club de Golf Bonalba
courses.description: Modern course with scenic layout, quality facilities, and professional coaching programs

courses.name: Club de Golf Meliá Villaitana
courses.description: Dual championship courses offering both seaside and mountain layouts with resort facilities
